title: What Boston looked like in 2019 when the Patriots last won the Super Bowl
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: In February 2019, the New England Patriots celebrated a Super Bowl win with a parade in Boston's Copley Square.
The Patriots' 2019 Super Bowl victory came before COVID-19, during Trump's presidency, and while Marty Walsh was Boston's mayor.
During early 2019, the Red Bull Crashed Ice event was held at Fenway Park and Encore Boston Harbor was still under construction.

title: Officer and civilian shot, suspect killed in Spencer
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Suspect Patrick Madison, 35, shot a civilian and was killed in a gunfire exchange with police in Spencer.
An officer was injured during the standoff at a Family Dollar store on West Main Street, Spencer, on February 3, 2026.
Police evacuated the area; the injured officer and civilian were transported to hospitals and are in stable condition.

title: Cape Cod house with Watergate ties falls victim to eroding bluff
author: Regina Cole
bullets: Demolition of the Bartlett House in Eastham began on February 3, 2026, due to erosion near Coast Guard Beach.
The house, linked to the Watergate scandal, was a retreat for Nixon's officials and associated with infamous activities.
National Seashore deemed the site unsafe in 2024; demolition will be followed by planting native vegetation.

title: UMass Lowell wants to make the city a destination with a new rink and hotel
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: UMass Lowell plans to build a new ice rink and hotel to boost Lowell's appeal as a destination.
The development is part of the Lowell Innovation Network Corridor, supported by city, state, and private partners.
The project aims to enhance economic growth, including increased event capacity at Tsongas Center and new business ventures.

title: Judge drops assault charge against former City Hall staffer
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Judge dropped assault charge against Chulan Huang, former Boston City Hall staffer, due to the victim's absence in court.
Huang's assault allegation followed a domestic incident with Marwa Khudaynazar, linked to Segun Idowu's interactions with her.
Khudaynazar is suing Boston, claiming her firing was to conceal Idowu's actions; court allowed her First Amendment claim to proceed.

title: This Rowley inn is the perfect place for romance
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Briar Barn Inn in Rowley recognized as a top Valentine’s Day destination by The Hotel Guru.
JetBlue and Delta Air Lines rated among the safest airlines in 2026 by AirlineRatings.com.
Great Wolf Lodge offering a one-day flash sale with rates of $26 per person for stays through June 18.

title: A dispute over a shoveled-out parking space led to a stabbing in Dorchester, police say
author: John Waller
bullets: A dispute over a shoveled-out parking space in Dorchester led to a stabbing, leaving two people injured.
The injured victims, a 41-year-old man and a 47-year-old woman, suffered significant hand injuries and were hospitalized.
Enel Javier, 47, was arrested and charged with assault and battery with a dangerous weapon following the incident.

title: Where to watch Super Bowl 2026 in Boston: 7 must-visit sports bars
author: Kevin Slane and Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Banners Kitchen & Tap in Boston features a 40-foot screen, a DJ, and Super Bowl packages with food and prizes.
Tony C’s locations offer numerous large TVs to watch the Patriots-Seahawks game, with venues in Somerville, Burlington, and Peabody.
PickleBOS in South Boston hosts a "Super Bowl Open Play & Watch Party" including pickleball, game streaming, and a catered food option.

title: Four charged in $1M SNAP, unemployment fraud scheme tied to Leominster restaurant
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Four individuals charged in $1 million SNAP and unemployment fraud using over 100 stolen identities linked to Leominster restaurant.
Joel Vicioso Fernandez, Roman Vequiz Fernandez, Coralba Albarracin Siniva, and Raul Fernandez Vicioso face multiple fraud charges.
El Primo Restaurant used illicit benefits to supply food, with proceeds wired to Venezuela and the Dominican Republic.

title: Local obituary: Jaylin Rainford, 20, Catholic Memorial grad and Bryant University junior
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Jaylin Douglas Rainford, 20, was a junior finance major at Bryant University and a Catholic Memorial High School graduate.
An avid athlete, Rainford recently switched from soccer to track and field, inspired by his faith.
Funeral services for Rainford will be held February 6-7 in Randolph, Massachusetts.
